Description: Body fragment of a pottery closed vessel (amphora? oinochoe?); on outside, cream slip and decoration in Wild Goat style: hook meander and broad black stripe below an animal frieze, part of body and hind legs of wild goat to left; ornament below; horned head of second wild goat to right. Hard, fine, bright yellow/reddish clay, Munsell 5YR 7/6; white inclusions; silver mica.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Findspot number '18' scratched on the reverse of the fragment by Petrie.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 330)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
